result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Interim Statement of service Hours in the amount of 1.7 hours submitted by contract Attorney Huebner.

[ma] Cases 22CF76 and 22CF77 called at 9:45am [Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
Defendant Darius L Ashford in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Darius L Ashford.  
Defendant Aaron Riles does not appear. Attorney Martin Russell Tanz appears via telephone for Aaron Riles. 
Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

As to Case 22CF76, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs: 
Mr. Ashford waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Court has learned off record that Atty Tanz intends on submitting motion. 
recess: 9:52am 

NEXT: As to Case 22CF76, Arraignment on 11/18/22 at 10:30am 
As to Case 22CF77, Status Conference on 11/18/22 at 10:30am

Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF76 and #22CF77 called at 3:33pm 
Co-Defendant Darius L Ashford in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.
Co-Defendant Aaron J Riles in court with Attorney Martin Tanz.
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to case #22CF76 Adjourned Initial Appearance is held:  
--preliminary hearing time limits are waived by both parties 
--Attorney Huebner requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference 
recess 3:40pm.  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference in Case #22CF76 only on August 10th at 10:00am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF76 on September 2nd at 9:30am, (3) Status Conference on  September 2nd at 9:30am in Case #22CF77--Attorney Tanz may appear by telephone, and Co-Defendant Aaron Riles does not need to appear
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ml] Case called at 2:43PM
Defendant Darius L Ashford in court, without counsel. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant states that he applied for the Public Defender's Office yesterday. The Court reviews a filing from the PD's Office, and states that the Defendant is not eligible for their services.

The Defendant reiterates that he was found eligible for their services.

The Court goes off the record to determine if the Defendant is eligible for a County Appointed Attorney.

Back on the record, the Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for a County appointed attorney, and instructs the Clerk to appoint counsel for this file.

The Court orders the Defendant to repay the Clerk of Court's Office at a rate of $25.00 a month, with the first payment due on or around 08/01/2022 and on or around the first of every month thereafter.

recess 2:54PM

NEXT: 
(1) Appointment of counsel is needed
(2) Status Conference on 07/29 at 3:00PM with in person appearances
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 22CF76 & 22CF77 called at 11:33am 
Defendant Aaron J Riles in court with Attorney Tanz 
Defendant Darius Ashford appears in court. 
ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 22CF76: Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Ashford indicates that he intends to hire private counsel, met with one yesterday.

As to Case 22CF77:
Mr. Riles waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 11:42am 

NEXT:  As to Case 22CF77(Riles) (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/13/22 at 10:00am    (2) Status Conference on 6/7/22 at 2:30pm 
As to Case 22CF76(Ashford): Status Conference on 6/7/22 at 2:30pm
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Reserve Judge Moroney presiding for Branch III:  
[MK] case called at 1:30pm 
Defendant Darius L Ashford in court.  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled as an Adjourned Initial Appearance today. 
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding efforts to obtain counsel, Mr. Ashford indicates that he has tried calling the Jefferson Public Defender's Office and gets recordings that they are not available.
The clerk attempts to telephone the Jefferson Public Defenders Office and receives a recorded message. The clerk leaves a voicemail with the case number, name, and Mr. Ashford's telephone number, requesting that PD Office staff telephone Mr. Ashford today or tomorrow regarding applying for PD representation. 
recess 1:35pm

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status-of-counsel hearing) on March 18th at 11:00am
Adjourned initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ma] Case called at 1:37 PM 
Defendant Darius L Ashford appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only--not evaluated).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel reviewed; Mr. Ashford intends to obtain private counsel

The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits

The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with co-defendant, Aaron Riles 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 1:43 pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/24/22 at 1:15pm (status of counsel?)
